Docs.param: used to control the speed of the motor
Docs.summary: Creates instance using only one pin which allows to control speed in one direction.
Docs.remarks: PWM pin can be connected to either enable pin of the H-bridge. or directly to the one of two inputs related with the motor direction (if H-bridge allows inputs to change frequently). Connecting motor directly to GPIO pin is not recommended and may damage your board.

Docs.param: used to control the speed of the motor
Pin used to control the direction of the motor
True to dispose the Gpio Controller
True if a controller with one direction input is used, false if a controller with two direction inputs is used
Docs.summary: Creates instance using two pins which allows to control speed in both directions.
Docs.remarks: should be connected to the one of two inputs related with the motor direction (if H-bridge allows inputs to change frequently), or to PWM input if a controller with one direction input is used. should be connected to H-bridge input corresponding to one of the motor inputs. or to direction input if a controller with one direction input is used. Connecting motor directly to GPIO pin is not recommended and may damage your board.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract double Speed { get; set; }
.property instance float64 Speed
Public MustOverride Property Speed As Double
member this.Speed : double with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the speed of the motor. Range is -1..1 or 0..1 for 1-pin connection. 1 means maximum speed, 0 means no movement and -1 means movement in opposite direction.
